meanings.definition: To place or arrange in a proper or suitable order.
meanings.sent1: I collocated the books on the shelf by size.
meanings.sent2: The librarian collocated the books by genre for easy access.
meanings.sent3: The students collocated their desks in a circle for group work.
meanings.sent4: She collocated the ingredients on the counter before starting to bake.
meanings.sent5: The team collocated their equipment efficiently before the game.

meanings.definition: To occur in close proximity to each other.
meanings.sent1: The houses collocated along the riverbank.
meanings.sent2: The shops collocated in the busy downtown area.
meanings.sent3: The birds collocated on the tree branches chirping happily.
meanings.sent4: The stars collocated in the night sky creating a beautiful scene.
meanings.sent5: The cars collocated at the traffic light waiting for the signal to change.
